blog.name: lotsoffandomimagines
blog.title: ✎ Just Imagine It ✎
blog.description:
☆ masterlist → rules → fandom list → about → fav imagines ☆
Hi! The name’s Ace. My blog runs on requests so send them in, but read my rules and fandom list before doing so! Gifs aren't mine. OC information is in my “about” link. Last but not least, this is a safe space for everyone! Be nice to each other and let your imagination soar.

summary: Dating Carol Danvers and Being Peter Quill’s Twin Sister Would Include...
body:
Dating Carol Danvers and Being Peter Quill’s Twin Sister Would Include…

•Meeting Carol for the first time when she brings Nebula and Tony back to Earth

•Not being able to go with Rocket or Nebula even though you’re a Guardian because being on your brother’s ship is too painful and brings back too many sad memories

•Eventually convincing Carol to allow you to go to space with her and spending the next five years assisting Carol on missions

•Starting a romantic relationship with one another during this time and Carol being the main reason you start to heal. You’ve lost so much but she helped you start to love again

  • “I’m so glad I have you because if I didn’t… I’d be all alone in this world”

•Your brother finding out that you and Carol are dating when he comes back to life, after the last battle with Thanos

•Chosing to stay with your girlfriend rather then rejoining the Guardians even when your brother comes back to life

  • “I’m going to miss you sis but I’m happy for you”
  • “Thanks Peter”

•Luckily since you’re still operating in space you run into your old friends from time to time so even though you’re staying with Carol you do see Peter again

•You and Peter always joking about how the Quill family seems to only be attractive to crazy powerful hot woman

•Having the same music taste as Peter and while you get Carol to listen to your own mixtapes she also introduces you to 90s music

•The same type of sense of humour being another thing you and your brother have in common and always making Carol laugh

  • “You’re a huge idiot Quill, but I love you to death”

REQUESTS ARE OPEN

summary: maybe the reason why both carol and jean discover that emotions are the source of their strength isn’t that one copied the other...
body: maybe the reason why both carol and jean discover that emotions are the source of their strength isn’t that one copied the other but that women are always told to suppress their emotions and any movie that tries, however clumsily, to speak to the relationship between women and power would probably want to address that

reblog.comment: maybe the reason why both carol and jean discover that emotions are the source of their strength isn’t that one copied the other but that women are always told to suppress their emotions and any movie that tries, however clumsily, to speak to the relationship between women and power would probably want to address that

summary: captain marvel and captain america parallels are all good and stuff, but I'm here for carol danvers and peter parker...
body:
captain marvel and captain america parallels are all good and stuff, but I’m here for carol danvers and peter parker parallels.

  • struggling hero, normal life interrupted by freak event
  • helped by nick fury
  • sweet sidekick
  • helps the little guy but does the big stuff too
  • masters alien tech
  • red and blue suit
  • would it be mean to say dead mentor?
  • always gets back up
  • ignored and back seated
  • cats
  • trust questionable mentors

blog.name: loveandsupportforcaptainmarvel
blog.title: Captain Marvel Doesn't Care For Your Sexism
blog.description: Blog dedicated to standing up to the hate directed at Captain Marvel

summary: I think the reaction that many men have had to the motorcycle scene in Captain Marvel is a perfect example of how men don’t want...
body: I think the reaction that many men have had to the motorcycle scene in Captain Marvel is a perfect example of how men don’t want women to defend themselves. If a man defends a woman who is being harassed by another man, everyone deems him to be a hero. Carol steals a guy’s bike after he’s been a jerk to her, or she forces him to give her the keys in the deleted scene, and men think that she’s a horrible person. If he had attacked her then I don’t think anyone would be upset since she was defending herself, but since he told her to smile, men are up in arms about it. These men are only okay with this if it is another man that defends the woman, because they think that men need to be the ones to protect women even though it’s men that are the ones who are attacking women. I think that this scene has caused such an uproar because men don’t think that catcalling is that big of a deal, so they see Carol stealing this guy’s bike as an unwarranted attack. They don’t want Carol to get back at this guy because they want her to stay quiet and ignore him, like what so many women have to do when this happens to them because they’re afraid for themselves. I think the men that are upset about this scene are the ones who catcall women, and they don’t want a movie that shows a woman defending herself against it because they want to keep doing what they’re doing and keep the control they feel they have over women.

They don’t want Carol to get back at this guy because they want her to stay quiet and ignore him, like what so many women have to do when this happens to them because they’re afraid for themselves. I think the men that are upset about this scene are the ones who catcall women, and they don’t want a movie that shows a woman defending herself against it because they want to keep doing what they’re doing and keep the control they feel they have over women.

If a man defends a woman who is being harassed by another man, everyone deems him to be a hero. Carol steals a guy’s bike after he’s been a jerk to her, or she forces him to give her the keys in the deleted scene, and men think that she’s a horrible person. If he had attacked her then I don’t think anyone would be upset since she was defending herself, but since he told her to smile, men are up in arms about it. These men are only okay with this if it is another man that defends the woman, because they think that men need to be the ones to protect women even though it’s men that are the ones who are attacking women. I think that this scene has caused such an uproar because men don’t think that catcalling is that big of a deal, so they see Carol stealing this guy’s bike as an unwarranted attack. They don’t want Carol to get back at this guy because they want her to stay quiet and ignore him, like what so many women have to do when this happens to them because they’re afraid for themselves. summary: Clint Barton: *goes on a five year murder spree* Men: ... Carol Danvers: *steals a guy’s bike after he’s a jerk to her* Men:...
body:
Clint Barton: *goes on a five year murder spree*

Men: …

Carol Danvers: *steals a guy’s bike after he’s a jerk to her*

Men: “Carol Danvers is a villain! She’s so evil, how could the movie have her do that if she’s supposed to be a hero? No hero would ever do that to another person! I’m so sick of Disney and their feminist agenda! askgfvcnjvskbgur!”

summary: Short answer: Y E S. Long answer: I have had it with insecure man-babies complaining about Carol because she’s presumably...
caption:
Short answer: Y E S.

Long answer: I have had it with insecure man-babies complaining about Carol because she’s presumably “arrogant” or “selfish” or “overpowered”. Y’all will happily cheer on Tony Stark, one of the most egotistic men on the planet and lose your shit over Captain America saving Bucky in Civil War, which was in context the most selfish f*cking thing he could have done in that situation, or throw your arms up in ecstasy when Thor single-handedly almost kills Thanos in Infinity War, but g o d f o r b i d Carol f*cking Danvers being a badass in her standalone movie and for a few scenes tops in Endgame. Go cry into your Captain America/Iron Man/whoever the hell you mouth-breathers worship bodypillows, but don’t f*cking pretend you’re deep by doing shit like this.

Just a sideblog so I can reblog anything series/film related without spamming my followers
SPN, Fantastic Beasts, Marvel, GoT, Good Omens, Star trek I guess, and many others

summary:
One thing I'll remember from 2019 will be that yellow eyes can make hot men even hotter
I mean...
And we're only halfway...
body:
One thing I’ll remember from 2019 will be that yellow eyes can make hot men even hotter

I mean…

And we’re only halfway through! Who’s next to come?
